cyclone.name: NATE
cyclone.current_location: about 25 miles SSW of San Andres Island
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest across Nicaragua and Honduras, then north into the Gulf of Mexico with a turn toward the north-northeast through the southeastern United States and into the Mid-Atlantic region.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: U.S. central Gulf Coast near the Louisiana–Mississippi border

weather_observation.watch_coast: Sandy Bay Sirpi, Nicaragua to the Honduras border (Central America)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Sandy Bay Sirpi, Nicaragua to Punta Castilla, Honduras (Central America)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central America, Yucatan Peninsula, U.S. Gulf Coast from Louisiana eastward to the Florida Panhandle, then inland across the Southeast and Mid-Atlantic states
weather_observation.wind: Gusty winds possible (20–35 kt) as the weakening cyclone passes inland Monday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge (<2 ft) possible in upper Chesapeake Bay
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain Monday–Tuesday with totals that could exceed 4 inches, leading to ponding and localized flash flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: River flooding and reduced visibility; potential debris flows in urban drainage areas affecting port logistics
